articles.headline: Divided on Impeaching Trump, Democrats Wrestle With Duty and Politics
articles.snippet: House Democrats are agonizing between their responsibilities to hold a president to account and the political implications for doing so.
articles.abstract: House Democrats are agonizing between their responsibilities to hold a president to account and the political implications for doing so.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — As Speaker Nancy Pelosi urges caution on impeachment, rank-and-file House Democrats are agonizing over the prospect of trying to oust President Trump, caught between their sense of historic responsibilities and political considerations in the wake of the special counsel’s damning portrait of abuses.
articles.byline: By Sheryl Gay Stolberg and Nicholas Fandos

articles.headline: Facebook Expects to Be Fined Up to $5 Billion by F.T.C. Over Privacy Issues
articles.snippet: Facebook and the agency have been in negotiations over a financial penalty for claims that the company violated a 2011 consent decree.
articles.abstract: Facebook and the agency have been in negotiations over a financial penalty for claims that the company violated a 2011 consent decree.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — Facebook said on Wednesday that it expected to be fined up to $5 billion by the Federal Trade Commission for privacy violations. The penalty would be a record by the agency against a technology company and a sign that the United States was willing to punish big tech companies.
articles.byline: By Mike Isaac and Cecilia Kang

articles.headline: Sri Lanka Suicide Bombers Included Two Sons of a Spice Tycoon
articles.snippet: The aura of success surrounding Mohammad Yusuf Ibrahim, head of a Sri Lanka spice empire, crashed on news that two of his sons were Easter Sunday bombers.
articles.abstract: The aura of success surrounding Mohammad Yusuf Ibrahim, head of a Sri Lanka spice empire, crashed on news that two of his sons were Easter Sunday bombers.
articles.lead_paragraph: COLOMBO, Sri Lanka — He built his fortune on black pepper, white pepper, nutmeg, cloves and vanilla. His family lived in a beautiful white villa and traveled in a chauffeured BMW. He was feted by Sri Lanka’s former president for “outstanding service provided to the nation.”
articles.byline: By Jeffrey Gettleman, Dharisha Bastians and Kai Schultz

articles.headline: Trump Vows Stonewall of ‘All’ House Subpoenas, Setting Up Fight Over Powers
articles.snippet: The president dismissed oversight investigations by House Democrats as partisan and illegitimate, signaling a new phase of confrontation.
articles.abstract: The president dismissed oversight investigations by House Democrats as partisan and illegitimate, signaling a new phase of confrontation.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — The Trump administration escalated its defiance of Congress on Wednesday, as the Justice Department refused to let an official testify on Capitol Hill and President Trump vowed to fight what he called a “ridiculous” subpoena ordering a former top aide to appear before lawmakers.

articles.headline: China Retools Vast Global Building Push Criticized as Bloated and Predatory
articles.snippet: Beijing is reshaping its plans for building a network of ports, rails and roads that enhance the country’s geopolitical ambitions. But it isn’t retreating.
articles.abstract: Beijing is reshaping its plans for building a network of ports, rails and roads that enhance the country’s geopolitical ambitions. But it isn’t retreating.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIJING — It took only a week for China’s all-powerful President Xi Jinping to yield. Malaysia had publicly slammed China for vastly overcharging on a showcase rail project, canceling the deal.

articles.headline: Cannabis, Marijuana, Weed, Pot? Just Call It a Job Machine
articles.snippet: As legalization spreads, listings for cannabis-related positions on recruitment sites have soared. But working in the industry comes with caveats.
articles.abstract: As legalization spreads, listings for cannabis-related positions on recruitment sites have soared. But working in the industry comes with caveats.
articles.lead_paragraph: SAN FRANCISCO — David Dancer is a 48-year-old marketing executive who has worked for big brands like Charles Schwab and Teleflora. A year ago, he got a call from a recruiter for a different kind of company: MedMen, a cannabis retailer that has been called “the Apple Store of weed.” The opening was for a chief marketing officer. He took it.

articles.headline: Joe Biden Announces 2020 Run for President, After Months of Hesitation
articles.snippet: The former vice president has stayed on the sidelines while his record has been scrutinized. His entry is sure to reshape the Democratic primary contest.
articles.abstract: The former vice president has stayed on the sidelines while his record has been scrutinized. His entry is sure to reshape the Democratic primary contest.
articles.lead_paragraph: Former Vice President Joseph R. Biden Jr. announced Thursday that he would seek the Democratic nomination to challenge President Trump in 2020, casting the election as a national emergency and asking Democrats to put the task of defeating Mr. Trump above all their other ambitions.
articles.byline: By Alexander Burns and Jonathan Martin

articles.headline: Who Owns Huawei? The Company Tried to Explain. It Got Complicated.
articles.snippet: The Chinese tech giant wants to put to rest concerns that it is susceptible to influence by the country’s government. That has been no easy task.
articles.abstract: The Chinese tech giant wants to put to rest concerns that it is susceptible to influence by the country’s government. That has been no easy task.
articles.lead_paragraph: SHENZHEN, China — For one of the world’s largest technology companies, it should be a simple question:
